hero.title: The lure of politics: Some celebrities shun the circus
hero.description: Manila, Philippines—“Paano kung manalo (What if I win)?”

primary.lead: Quad Committee Hearings on Duterte Administration Issues
primary.title: How Duterte's 5 am call to Garma starts a nationwide drug war
primary.description: Garma's affidavit corroborates a lot of things, including Espenido's earlier allegation that cops were financially rewarded under Duterte's drug war

secondary.title: Philippines not renewing membership to ICC
secondary.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has remained firm on his stand against the country’s renewal of membership to the International Criminal Court (ICC).

secondary.title: ‘Reward system’ during past illegal drug operations validates CHR’s 2021 findings
secondary.description: As early as 2021, the Commission on Human Rights (CHR) had validated the concept of “awards, rewards, recognition” to policemen for the killings of suspected illegal drugs offenders.

secondary.title: Duterte to attend quad comm hearing if invited
secondary.description: If invited, former president Rodrigo Duterte will attend the House of Representatives quad committee hearings on extrajudicial killings.

carousel.title: Teachers dismayed over law removing mother tongue in K-3
carousel.description: Several teachers groups expressed concern over the new policy that discontinued the use of the mother tongue as a medium of instruction from Kindergarten to Grade 3.

carousel.title: PH among most food-insecure nations in SE Asia: think tank
carousel.description: The Philippines ranked as among the most food insecure nation in Southeast Asia from 2021-2023, think tank Ibon Foundation said.

carousel.title: American reportedly kidnapped in Philippines and shot in leg as he resisted
carousel.description: Police in the Philippines say they've launched a search after gunmen reportedly abducted an American national who was shot in the leg as he tried to resist.

carousel.title: ‘Mercury destroys lives’: but if goldmining is here to stay, is there a way to make it safer?
carousel.description: Using the toxin for gold extraction is banned in the Philippines, but the practice remains widespread. Now one town is trialling a technique that could end its use and protect the world’s 15 million small-scale miners
